data.title: Various RA/TD mod shp fixes
data.body:
- fixed non-remapable pixels on idle airfield.
- removed green pixels from interior mine.
- compressed several previously uncompressed shps in ra/bits, shaving off a few hundred KB of space and possibly some milliseconds of loading time, too.
- compressed several previously uncompressed shps in cnc/bits, shaving off a few hundred KB of space and possibly some milliseconds of loading time, too. hclock.shp was brought down from 333 KB to ~10KB, apcmuz and apc turrets saw a massive shrink as well.

data.title: Include time stamps in game chat
data.body:
In terms of game time or real time?
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/2273042-include-time-stamps-in-game-chat?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Production icons
data.body: Changes how the production queue gets its icons, the icon name is no longer in the renderer and has been moved to the buildable trait. There is also a  new upgrade rule that converts all yaml files to this new format.

data.title: Replaces uncompressed sniper.shp with a  XCC-Mixer-compressed version
data.body: Might fix #5383, or at least save some space.

data.title: Give PerfTimer the ability to write only slow operations to the log
data.body: This is useful to ignore fast operations that just spam the log

data.title: Large jank when displaying new icons in the production palette.
data.body: This is most visible when you enable the "build everything" cheat in D2K.  I suspect that this is a regression from #5234 - have we accidentally deferred the sprite atlas creation until we actually try to load a sprite? Because that would be pretty bad.

data.title: Lower BridgeHut Selectable Priority
data.body:
Fixes #4738 where player was unable unable to attack units/buildings that
are next to or on a bridge.

I didn't notice any regressions, it simply reorders the actor list so that the BridgeHut is no longer the first in the list, which caused the cursor/action evaluation to not consider enemy units that were on the bridge.  This only fixes the issue with attacking on or near the bridge and does not solve the issue where it shows the move-blocked cursor when trying to order units to move onto the bridge.

data.title: Fix strategic map replay exception
data.body:
The game crashes when trying to start a replay of the map Crossroads with two teams.

```
Exception of type `System.ArgumentNullException`: Argument cannot be null.
Parameter name: key
  at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2[OpenRA.Player,OpenRA.Traits.Stance].get_Item (OpenRA.Player key) [0x000a2] in /build/mono/src/mono-3.2.8/mcs/class/corlib/System.Collections.Generic/Dictionary.cs:148 
  at OpenRA.WorldUtils.AreMutualAllies (OpenRA.Player a, OpenRA.Player b) [0x00008] in ~/openra/OpenRA.Game/WorldUtils.cs:191 
  at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Widgets.StrategicProgressWidget.Draw () [0x000e2] in ~/openra/OpenRA.Mods.RA/Widgets/StrategicProgressWidget.cs:49 
  at OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.DrawOuter () [0x00013] in ~/openra/OpenRA.Game/Widgets/Widget.cs:375 
  at OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.DrawOuter () [0x00033] in ~/openra/OpenRA.Game/Widgets/Widget.cs:377 
  at OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.DrawOuter () [0x00033] in ~/openra/OpenRA.Game/Widgets/Widget.cs:377 
  at OpenRA.Widgets.Ui.Draw () [0x00006] in ~/openra/OpenRA.Game/Widgets/Widget.cs:70 
  at OpenRA.Game.Tick (OpenRA.Network.OrderManager orderManager) [0x0010c] in ~/openra/OpenRA.Game/Game.cs:152

  at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) [0x00011] in ~/openra/OpenRA.Game/Support/Program.cs:110 
  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00050] in ~/openra/OpenRA.Game/Support/Program.cs:34 
```

data.title: Added the Tiberian Sun light post
data.body: This is based on TSTLAMP from rules.ini so may have been an early tech demo which is kinda like the same state our mod is right now. Obviously something is not quite right with our alpha blending mode. We seem to need the opposite of Subtractive which turns out that is not Additive nor Multiply.

data.title: Vehicle units start on infantry subcells
data.body:
All support units start on infantry sub-coordinates.
Causes somewhat weird-looking movement once you order them to move, when they'll go back to cell-center.

data.title: Train Locomotion
data.body:
TS has a few missions with moving trains (restricted to their tracks of course) so we will need this logic.
It is over my head unfortunately so we'll have to wait until someone with the know-how has the free time and drive to add it.

I must admit I want this for personal reasons and would like to see it sooner than later.
If someone pings me on IRC and walks me through adding a bounty (without using PayPal) I'll be glad to.

data.title: Added the Dune 2000 starport lights
data.body: I just stumpled upon some sequences next to the repair animation.

data.title: Added upgrades
data.body: This adds a new build queue and a new type of buildables named upgrades, they might need some extra variables to tweak but this is a start. Also included a test upgrade to test, let me know when you want to merge and I will remove it.

data.title: Added in the ability to put prerequisites on support powers.
data.body: This is an extension to the tech system that would allow more control over when players are given support powers.

data.title: Added the Dune 2000 repair depot active overlay
data.body: The new traits may also useful for Tiberian Sun.

data.title: Fixed temperat trees showing up in the Tiberian Dawn DESERT tileset
data.body: This was already fixed for Red Alert in https://github.com/Mailaender/OpenRA/pull/8.

data.title: Replay meta: include map
data.body:
Since maps change from time to time, and getting the right version is tricky, adding the map itself to the replay would be very useful. It would also simplify giving a replay to someone else to watch, since it would only require 1 file instead of the replay and the map. It also prevents the situation where a replay is unwatchable because no one can find the right version of the map played on. (This could be an issue recently, e.g. in TD all the maps are being modified by a script to keep up with a change in how tiberium trees are handled). This is also significant in balance testing, where map yaml changes frequently to adapt to test new balance settings. 

Usually maps are small while replays are comparatively large, so this shouldn't add a big problem for file sizes. However, I realize this might cause a problem when people use very large maps with custom graphics, units, etc. so maybe the program could opt to not include the map in the replay if it exceeds a certain file size. 

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/2241235-replay-meta-include-map?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Possible fix for lua crash #5269
data.body: The changes here fix some disposing issues but this crash is very hard to reproduce so I can't really tell if it has been fixed.

data.title: Yaml undercase rules problems
data.body:
If I name an actor like so:

TURTLE,

and I reference from a transforms trait like so:

Transforms:
    IntoActor: TURTLE
    Offset: 0,0
    Facing: 0
    TransformSounds: constru2.aud, hvydoor1.aud

the game should not crash, however, it does. This works though:

Transforms:
    IntoActor: turtle
    Offset: 0,0
    Facing: 0
    TransformSounds: constru2.aud, hvydoor1.aud

data.title: Custom options for click-and-drag scrolling
data.body: Using the middle mouse button to drag scroll is a bit of an annoyance for me watching and recording replays. I use 2 different mouses and with both of them it doesn't feel quite right. In-game it's a trivial matter but if in replay mode you could choose to switch drag-scrolling to e.g. right mouse button, it would IMO make replay viewing a better experience.

data.title: Updated 2 of psydev's recent TD maps -- minor fixes
Removed duplicates identified by RPMlint
data.body: A test build at https://build.opensuse.org/package/show/home:Mailaender:branches:games/openra exposed several duplicated (and unused) files. This cleans it up almost entirely.

data.title: Separated tools and /usr/bin shortcuts
data.body: This fixes the Makefile for Mono < 3 (Fedora, openSUSE 12.2, Ubuntu 12.04) where the TilesetEditor.exe fails to build and makes it easier to separate those optional WinForms tools.

data.title: Maps update - 2 from D2K reintroduced, 1 TD fixed
data.body:
Updated D2K map, "Black Mesa" to work with new tileset, and re-uploaded. 

Fixed up some minor errors in letters_from_lexington and also narrowed width at the same time.

data.title: make.ps1 occasionally fails to exit after building
data.body:
It will occasionally pause indefinitely after invoking MSBuild and just sit there, as if MSBuild isn't exiting after the build is complete, or the waiting code is broken.

data.title: Update TD chrome.svg (again)
data.body: Sorry, my bad.  Forgot to save the svg (again) before committing #5357.  I double checked that this does indeed match chrome.png this time.

data.title: More animation types need overlay support
data.body: This is needed at least for the TS Obelisk charge animation, and probably a few other cases.

data.title: wish: stats in chat after match
data.body:
Some users do not know about stats, or would not read.

The server chat should after game is ended say:

"xxx is victorius
Norman built most units, player_pl killed the most, nukem earned the most, and newbie lost most units"

data.title: Renamed OpenRA.Support.Random aka XRandom to MersenneTwister
data.body: So that our own pseudo random number generator does not collide with the ones provided by Mono/.NET.
